TITLE: Why creating a horror movie haven on Netflix may be a smart move for the streaming giant
SUMMARY: Netflix has spent big in recent years on flashy, blockbuster-style action movies, meanwhile it's found success in the comparatively low-budget horror genre.

TITLE: Some consumers are cutting back on restaurant spending, but CEOs say not all chains are affected
SUMMARY: Bloomin' Brands, Restaurant Brands International and Starbucks said they aren't seeing changes in consumer spending.

TITLE: Why Mark Zuckerberg's other big bet, outside the metaverse, is Whatsapp for business
SUMMARY: Long-term, Mark Zuckerberg is all-in on the metaverse. But Meta is also making a big bet that Whatsapp for Business will be a huge growth driver first.

TITLE: As climate change threatens more homes, some properties are getting too costly to insure
SUMMARY: As climate change threatens the U.S. with more natural disasters, it's becoming increasingly costly for Americans to insure their homes, experts say.

TITLE: Large Indiana employers Eli Lilly and Cummins speak out about the state's new restrictive abortion law
SUMMARY: Eli Lilly, one of the biggest employers in Indiana, said that the state's newly passed restrictions on abortions will push it to grow away from its home turf.

TITLE: Netflix is expanding its push into video games, but few subscribers are playing along
SUMMARY: Netflix has been rolling out the games as a way to keep users engaged between show releases. But estimates suggest few subscribers are playing.

TITLE: Higher prices, skimpier portions and apps — how fast-food chains are changing value deals
SUMMARY: Fast-food chains have been working on providing focused value to consumers through mobile applications and rewards programs, as they pull away from traditional value menu offerings.

TITLE: More Americans are working part-time — a potential harbinger of future jobs market instability
SUMMARY: "Involuntary part-time workers," those in part-time positions for economic reasons, increased by a seasonally-adjusted 303,000 in July.

TITLE: Bed Bath & Beyond is discontinuing a private brand as it tries to reverse declining sales
SUMMARY: The retailer had made an aggressive push into exclusive brands and touted them as a linchpin of its turnaround strategy.

TITLE: SpaceX raises another $250 million in equity, lifts total to $2 billion in 2022
SUMMARY: Elon Musk's SpaceX raised $250 million in a July equity round, the company disclosed in a securities filing on Friday.

TITLE: Warner Bros. Discovery CEO David Zaslav embraces the past as he plans his company's future
SUMMARY: Unlike WarnerMedia's last CEO, new chief David Zaslav is embracing movie theaters and traditional cable TV instead of taking a streaming-first attitude.

TITLE: Space factory startup Varda secures NASA partnerships ahead of demo flight next year
SUMMARY: The agreements secure Varda access to key technologies the company will need for the first demonstration of its space factory system.

TITLE: President Joe Biden tests negative for Covid-19 after rebound case
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden tested negative for Covid-19 but will continue to isolate, according to the White House.

TITLE: 'I work just 5 hours a week': This 39-year-old makes $160,000 a month in passive income—a look at his typical day
SUMMARY: After Graham Cochrane lost his audio engineer job in 2009, he started a music blog. Now, what began as a side hustle has turned into a $160,000-per-year passive income stream. Working just five hours a week, here's what his typical day looks like.

TITLE: 'Stressed out' STD clinics struggle to handle surge in monkeypox patients as U.S. outbreak grows
SUMMARY: Sexual health clinics are facing a surge of patients seeking testing, vaccines and treatment for monkeypox.

TITLE: The lesson for Main Street from the Walmart, Target inventory failures
SUMMARY: Big box retailers bet wrong on inventory and big markdowns followed as inflation and Covid changed consumer spending patterns. Main Street can do better.

TITLE: Beyond Meat cuts revenue outlook, says it's trimming workforce
SUMMARY: Beyond Meat on Thursday lowered its revenue forecast for 2022 and announced it will trim its workforce by 4%, citing broader economic uncertainty.

TITLE: AMC plans to issue 517 million shares of preferred stock, under the ticker symbol 'APE'
SUMMARY: The company has applied to list these preferred equity units on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "APE."

TITLE: Oil companies are giving back tons of cash — and other things we've learned this earnings season
SUMMARY: After making it through the busiest three weeks of earnings season, we're taking a step back and making sense of some of the common themes.

TITLE: Here are 5 stocks in our portfolio that can benefit from rising interest rates
SUMMARY: A strong labor market with robust wage gains might mean the Fed still has more work to do.

TITLE: Burger King parent says more customers are redeeming coupons and loyalty rewards
SUMMARY: More customers at Burger King and its sister brands are redeeming coupons and loyalty program rewards as inflation pushes menu prices higher.

TITLE: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Lyft, Carvana, Warner Bros. Discovery, DraftKings
SUMMARY: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

TITLE: New York polio case is the 'tip of the iceberg,' hundreds of others could be infected, health official says
SUMMARY: New York's top health official warned the polio case in an unvaccinated adult and the detection of the virus in sewage could indicate there's a larger outbreak.

TITLE: Warner Bros Discovery's DC universe, and its direct-to-streaming strategy, are getting a reset
SUMMARY: The decision to shelve "Batgirl" surprised fans and offered a glimpse into the streaming strategy and new no-nonsense era under recently installed Zaslav.

TITLE: Virgin Galactic again delays space tourism flights, to second quarter 2023
SUMMARY: Virgin Galactic postponed the beginning of commercial flights by another three months, with the company citing delays in work refurbishing its carrier aircraft.

TITLE: Higher housing costs force more pet owners to surrender their dogs
SUMMARY: Shelters across the country are hearing from more pet owners that they've been forced to surrender their animals due to housing or financial constraints.

TITLE: 5 things to know before the stock market opens Friday
SUMMARY: Here are the most important news items that investors need to start their trading day.

SUMMARY: Goldman Sachs' Michele Della Vigna made his comments during an interview with CNBC on Thursday.

SUMMARY: These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell: Expedia, Block, Lyft and more.

TITLE: The price of a pint is going through the roof. Here’s why UK beer costs are far outpacing inflation
SUMMARY: The average cost of a pint of beer in the U.K. has soared by 70% since 2008 — well ahead of inflation.
